content: auckland bound this hat was originally designed in 2019 during the first planning stages of a hopeful family trip abroad and each stitch was made with the excitement and anticipation of that trip even though it still hasn t happened yet with this free pattern i hope to pass the traveler s spirit along to other knitters the body of this hat is knit in a simple broken rib stitch and the brim features one of my favorite methods the permanently folded edge achieved using a provisional cast-on giving you a hat that s extra toasty notes dimensions 17 5 20 22 5 circumference hat body  if you are between sizes i recommend sizing down needles  size us 3/3 25 mm 16 circular needles  size us 5/3 75 mm 16 circular needles  size us 5/3 75 mm dpns or long circular needles for magic loop  optional size us 3 or smaller circular knitting needles any length yarn 215 230 245 yds/195 210 225 m dk or worsted weight yarn  orange sample used hedgehog fibres - merino dk in colorway monarch  red sample used the plucky knitter - cozy in colorway antiqued notions four stitch markers including one unique for bor 20 of waste yarn in contrasting color tapestry needle gauge 24 sts x 34 row = 4 x 4 broken rib stitch worked in the round  broken rib in the round over an even # of sts round 1 knit round 2 *k1 p1* around auckland bound pg 1 © 2022 maddy moe abbreviations st / sts stitch / stitches bor beginning of the round k / p knit/purl sm / pm slip or place marker respectively k2tog knit the next two sts together decreases one ssk slip 1 slip 1 pass these sts to the left needle knit them together through the back loop creates left-leaning decreasing stitch decreases one sl1-k2tog-psso worked across the next three sts on the left needle slip 1 stitch knitwise knit the next two stitches together then pass the slipped stitch over the k2tog stitch on the right needle decreases two helpful methods provisional cast-on this method keeps live sts at the cast on edge which are kept from unraveling by some length of waste yarn these stitches are picked up later to create a permanently folded brim by joining your live stitches to your stitches at the cast on edge here is the method i recommend https //www youtube com/watch v=dxp8runxjty this hat is worked starting at the brim and working upward finishing at the crown the brim is worked so that it can be permanently folded beginning with a provisional cast-on and working it to be twice as long as desired then working one round to join the live sts at the cast on edge to the live sts on your needles the rest of the hat is worked as normal directions using size us 3 needles and a length of waste yarn cast
